poem:
Title: "Ode to a Melodious Rebellion"

With a baton and deft defiance,
Golda, my love, spins Mozart into a dance.
She renders the maestro, a baffled ally,
In concert halls where opera takes stance.
Her voice, a tapestry, where Don Giovanni meets Figaro,
Every aria an audacious crescendo.
In every note, she says; "Così fan tutte.
Mozart, you drive me absurdly mute."
